newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - March 5.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - S.Korean newspapers - March 5.

text.p: The following is a summary of major stories in leading South Korean newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Seoul. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (822) 727-5650. Fax: (822) 727-5666.
- New Prime Minister Koh Kun yesterday called for an open government and a transparent administration and pledged to push for a drastic deregulation compaign.
- Shindongbang Group is soon expected to begin buying Midopa shares through public subscription, sources said.
- Ex-Prime Minister Lee Soo Sung joined the ruling New Korea Party yesterday as a standing adviser, firmly establishing his status as one of the ruling camp's presidential hopefuls.
- Korea's current-account deficit to top $19 billion this year, according to the International Monetary Fund.
